meanings.definition: A form of land tenure in England where land is held by copy of the court roll.
meanings.sent1: In the past, copyholds were common in England for holding land.
meanings.sent2: The copyholds system allowed people to have rights to land based on court records.
meanings.sent3: The copyholds arrangement made land ownership feel like a historical treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her copyholds on the estate were like pieces of a puzzle that fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The concept of copyholds can be compared to having a secret map to land ownership.

meanings.definition: The land held in this manner.
meanings.sent1: The copyholds were passed down through generations in the family.
meanings.sent2: Many farmers worked on the copyholds and took care of the land.
meanings.sent3: The copyholds seemed to have a magical quality, bringing luck to those who tended to them.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the copyholds landscape was like a painting that changed with the seasons.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the copyholds felt like stepping into a storybook world of ancient traditions.
